hackathon-description-text: C3 is organized by students at the University of Toronto who wanted to provide their peers with an opportunity to challenge themselves and learn by building.
hackathon-eligibility: Each team member must be a university student
hackathon-requirements: A valid submission includes some sort of functioning creation

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The Hatchery will set your team up with a lunch with some of their fantastic mentors who are leaders throughout Canada's business and entrepreneurship communities.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: The Entrepreneurship Hatchery - Most Business Potential

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=140 Saint George Street, University of Toronto - St. George Campus, Toronto, ON M5S 3G6, Canada

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Does the app work? Does it accomplish its goal? How easy is the app to use?
Would people use this? How much would it affect users who did? Does the app have follow-up options or growth potential?
Is this a creative or new solution to a problem? Does the app do something new or unique?

hackathon-location-address: 140 Saint George Street, University of Toronto - St. George Campus, Toronto, ON M5S 3G6, Canada
hackathon-description-header: Join a hundred other students at the University of Toronto, to code, collaborate and create anything you desire. Whether you're a software guru or a beginner everyone is welcome!
